result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J Nygaard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Daniel J Nygaard failed to appear.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(8:48)
State - deft complied with doing 30 hrs comm serv - jail can be vacated

COURT:  Jail time vacated

Defendant, Daniel J Nygaard with Attorney Joshua D Christianson appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(3:07)
State - deft has posted restitution $963.60 - restitution form filed - 10 days jail, $243 cc, $200 dna surchg, $10 drug surchg - 
Christianson - argues jail time to no jail time - requests surchg not be ordered as is this was June 2014 matter and doesn't believe they applied then
Court addresses the deft
Deft - pleads 

COURT:  plea voluntary - finds deft guilty
$243 cc
$200 dna surchg
$  10 drug surchg
***BOND APPLIES IN $245.13 - PAYMENT PLAN***
30 hrs community service within 6 months or 10 days jail
  Review hearing scheduled for December 5, 2016 at 08:45 am.

Defendant, Daniel J Nygaard with Attorney Joshua D Christianson appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(8:32)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
State - plea to Theft 15CM56 - set for sentencing - deft will come up with restitution by sentencing date - also plea to failure to notify 15TR2790 - dismiss 15CT100, 15TR2789 - deft has paid $245.13 to COC for rest. - will file worksheet for restitution

Deft - 15CM56    - pleads no contest - waives rights & JT
          15TR2790 - pleads no contest

COURT:  15TR2790 finds deft guilty - $389.50 forf - PAYMENT PLAN
15CM56 - plea voluntary - finds deft guilty

Rest of $245.13 has been paid to COC for restitution - DA to provide worksheet

DISMISS:  15CT100, 15TR2789  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant, Daniel J Nygaard with Attorney Joshua D Christianson appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(3:11)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
Christianson - no resolution - requests traffic matter set for trial

COURT:  set jury trial on 15CT100 TR's & 15CM56 tagalong
motions & spec instructions five days prior to FPT
  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 11:00 am.  Hearing scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant, Daniel J Nygaard with Attorney Joshua D Christianson appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(9:32)
Christianson - have agreement on this matter and traffic matter set next Friday - wants new plea sentencing date

COURT:  grants continuance of both matters - 15CT100
bonds continue
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant, Daniel J Nygaard with Attorney Joshua D Christianson appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Kim Silvius - Clerk

bond continues
